name: sandlot
content:

a piece of ground with no buildings on it, especially when this is used for informal sports games : Since the beginning of time, every sandlot has housed the "mean kid" and his cronies. At the end of our two-block alley was a small sandlot playground with swings and slides.
More examplesFewer examplesEvenings were spent playing pickup games in backyards and sandlots.They are generally are no harder to handle than a group of the same age on a sandlot or hockey rink.Discovered on a San Antonio sandlot by scout Al LaMacchia in 1964, Gaston played parts of 11 seasons in the majors.

used to refer to a sport played for pleasure, rather than as a job, or to people or things related to this type of sport: He had a paper route and played sandlot baseball. He found himself relegated to that graveyard of all inept sandlot ballplayers, right field.
More examplesFewer examplesHe played a year of sandlot football with a team called Car Credit.He covered Super Bowls and sandlot games.Blomberg was raised in Atlanta, where sandlot teammates acknowledged his talent.
